title: Mangrove forest decline on Iran’s Gulf coast | Science
content: Iran’s mangrove forests, which cover about 9370 ha along the Persian Gulf and the Sea of Oman, are home to distinct species (1–3), store carbon (1, 2), purify water (4), and support coastal communities (1). However, these forests face threats from human activities and climate change (5). Iran must protect its mangrove forests (1).
